clinical_study.brief_title: Diagnostic Value of Patient - Reported and Clinically Verified Olfactory Disorders (COVID-19)
clinical_study.official_title: Diagnostic Value of Patient - Reported and Clinically Verified Olfactory Disorders in a Population Tested for COVID-19

brief_summary.textblock: Participants are healthcare workers and adult outpatients referred in a COVID-19 screening center. Patients-reported symptoms are collected, then participants underwent a simple olfactory test (CODA for Clinical Olfactory Dysfunction Assessment), prior to swabbing for SARS-CoV-2 diagnosis (RT-PCR). We aimed to evaluate the prevalence of smell and taste disorders, and to calculate the diagnostic value of patient-reported and clinically verified smell disorders in persons with suspected COVID-19.

primary_outcome.measure: Diagnostic values of anosmia and ageusia for COVID-19
primary_outcome.description: Diagnostic values of anosmia and ageusia for COVID-19 with questionnaire

secondary_outcome.description: Diagnostic values of CODA (Clinical Olfactory dysfunction Assessment) score for COVID-19 : Simple, fast, semi-objective olfactory test developed for epidemic context

arm_group.description: Healthcare workers and adult outpatients attending the COVID-19 screening center of the University Hospital of Montpellier, France.

intervention.intervention_name: Reporting of anosmia, ageusia and other clinical symptoms
intervention.description: Reporting of anosmia, ageusia and other clinical symptoms related to COVID-19 - CODA test - SARS-CoV2 RT-PCR and ELISA

study_pop.textblock: Healthcare workers and adult outpatients attending the COVID-19 screening center of the University Hospital of Montpellier, France.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion criteria:
- Symptoms compatible with COVID-19
- Close exposure to a confirmed COVID-19 index case
- Ambulatory (asymptomatic, or if symptomatic, did not require hospitalisation, thus with initial mild disease)
Exclusion criteria:
- known history of smell and taste disorders
- testing inability (cognitive impairment, non native French speakers, test malingering)
- testing contraindication (children, pregnancy, breastfeeding, specific allergies).
